column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////It was my mom's first time to Chicago
column2: and we knew deep-dish had to be part of the agenda. I had been to Gino's East before
column3: but thought maybe I'd try another of the popular joints. This wasn't too far from our hotel
column4: so my mom and I dropped by for lunch. We ended up waiting about 15-20 minutes
column6: you can pre-order your pizza at a counter so that it's baking while you're waiting/getting seated. I was STILL in line when we actually were seated
column7: so I didn't even get to put in my order.
